Just curious if any of you have heard of Prop 63 in California, this is a clip from a recent news story about how it works. Also, it passed.
 
 It would work like this: Someone earning a taxable income of $1.5 million would pay 1% of $500,000 or $5,000 extra in income tax. Those earning $2 million would pay 1% of $1 million or an extra $10,000. The money collected, an estimated $750 million in the coming fiscal year, would be placed in a special fund to be used for expanding mental health services, mostly at the local level. To prevent supplanting, the measure bars the government from reducing allocations for mental health services below current levels - not for the next few years but forever.

Do you have any proof that mental health facilities have been experiencing less funding?

 
 I worked for a mental health facility called MCDS. I worked with clients that were very mentally handicapped. They were not able to give themselves showers and some couldn't even feed themselves. Taking care of each client took a lot of money, because there had to be special showers for their wheelchairs, medications, special beds, etc. It is not cheap. While working there we were informed that due to government cutbacks all the clients were going to be kicked out of the facility. Some were supposed to move back in with families, most of which could not support the expenses for the mentally handicapped client, so what they would have done with them we don't know. It's a very scary thing to think about. The same time that their funds got cut, the prisons were getting more funding. I don't think it's fair for people who do things out of their own free will to be gaining more than those who were more than likely born with the handicap. There has been much more proof of the funding being cut. It's very sad and very serious.
